#summary Installation step be step

== Download and Check demo ==
  # Download latest distributions from *Downloads* tab
  # Unzip archive to _yourdir_
  # open _yourdir_/demo.html in web browser. You should be able to work with demo content.

== Include player in your web page ==
  # copy _yourdir_/qtiplayer folder to you website
  # Include it in you web page
  # copy defaultplayer.css or create new CSS and include it in your webpage
  # Upload content (QTI files)
  # create tag for player in web page with id 
  # Declare qpOnAppLoaded() function and create player there
  # If you want to send result to the server then declare onAssessmentFinished() function

== Sample web page ==
{{{
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN">
<html>
  <head>
    <meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">

    <link type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" href="defaultplayer.css">

    <title>QTI Player demo</title>
    
    <script type="text/javascript" language="javascript"   src="qtiplayer/qtiplayer.nocache.js"></script>
    <script language="javascript">
    	function qpOnAppLoaded(){
    		// Load assessment
    		var player = qpCreatePlayer('myplayer');
    		player.load('content/test.xml');
    	}

 	// Optional function to handle assessment result
 	player.onAssessmentFinished = function(result){
          alert('Score: ' + result.score + ' out of ' + result.max);
    	}

    </script>

  </head>

  <body>

    <div id="myplayer"/>
	
  </body>
</html>

}}}
